title: Reclaiming People-Centred Development in an Age of Retrogression: Reflections on Doha Summit
content: During the World Summit for Social Development in Doha, discussions unfolded with a mix of hope, urgency, and unease.
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: Call for Participants for Young Scholars Workshop: Feminist Approaches to Macroeconomic Policy in East Africa
content: Call for Participants for the Young Scholars Workshop on "Feminist Approaches to Macroeconomic Policy in East Africa".
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: Economic Dogma Blocks Pragmatic Policies
content: After condemning pragmatic responses to the 1997-98 Asian financial crises, the West pursued similar policies in response to the 2008 global financial crisis without acknowledging its own mistakes.
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: The Fairy Dust of Digitalisation: Why Tech Won’t Deliver Social Development
content: One issue remained conspicuously absent from the WSSD II: the unequal distribution of power in the global economy.
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: China’s Trade Relations Need Reform
content: China’s export growth and record trade surplus, in a year when it has been partially shut out from US markets, signal the need to seek greater balance in its trade with other nations.
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: The Silence on Macroeconomics: A Critical Miss for WSSD II
content: The importance of WSSD II was undercut by a key omission: the discussions paid little attention to the macroeconomic frameworks that continue to constrain social development.
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: The Solutions Approach of WSSD II: A Missed Opportunity to Promote Transformational Approaches to Social Development?
content: The organisers of the recently concluded Second World Summit on Social Development in Doha decided to focus on solutions to social development, not the problems.
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: Reflections from the World Summit for Social Development: A Series of Blogs
content: The blogs present different perspectives on the agenda of the World Summit for Social Development, a range of issues raised in the sessions and panels, and the Doha Political Declaration.
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: The New Resource Wars: U.S. Militarism and Latin America’s Development Dilemma
content: The United States’ military assault on Venezuelan territory and the abduction of President Maduro mark a decisive turning point in Washington’s hemispheric strategy—with likely global repercussions, of course. While the operation signals a return to direct interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean—reviving methods many assumed consigned to the past—it should hardly come as a surprise. The approach was explicitly outlined in the National Security Strategy released by the Trump Administrati...
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.

title: A Theory of Imperialism
content: Order Online Authors: Prabhat Patnaik and Utsa Patnaik Year: 2024 Edition: Third A brief theory of historical and modern imperialism rooted in unequal production capabilities and the enforcement of income deflation on ex-colonised and developing nations to sustain the value of money under capitalism. In this book, Utsa Patnaik and Prabhat Patnaik present a set of novel ideas about the origins and dynamics of capitalism that fundamentally differ from ‘mainstream economics’ and challenge the syste...
creator: Philip Nalangan
sourceDescription: A global network of progressive economists conducting critical analysis on economic policy and development through research, teaching, and debate.
